ygData.subject: Re: Polished Granite Tomahawk
ygData.msgSnippet: What is the SBH? and by not being in the room (ref. the TSK with the BBC) what exactly do you mean?  Not in the SK room? not anywhere in that WHOLE room (as
ygData.messageBody:
What is the SBH?

and by "not being in the room" (ref. the TSK with the BBC) what exactly do
you mean? Not in the SK room? not anywhere in that WHOLE room (as in dont
go through the secret door?)

And what if someone falls down the well, does that screw up the spawn?

thanks, my friends camped that place for 3 days just trying to get a BBC and
a Gos robe with no luck.

> ----------
> From: Nick Morgowicz[SMTP:nomorgow@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 5:47 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Polished Granite Tomahawk
>
> From: Nick Morgowicz <nomorgow@...>
>
> On Mon, 24 May 1999, James Wofford wrote:
>
> > From: James Wofford <James.Wofford@...>
> >
> > Why would you want the price of the item to go down? The economy in EQ
> is
> > being blown by people who "farm" equipment to sell for cheap prices just
> to
> > farther themselves a tiny amount. IMO this sucks. I remember when you
>
> Just because I know there are many people like me who cannot afford them.
> I'm at level 19 and i have very little spare cash. I do not die very
> often and do not understand how people can flaunt 200pp for items when
> i've never even seen that much money before. My guess is that the people
> who have all this money either have no lives, playing all day long, dying
> a lot, and camping item spots to pay for other item spots. All this
> inflation is bullshit and once we start, as a group, helping one another
> out, it will all phase down.
>
> > mino axe now. But for things like a BBC, SBH, or Tomahawk, why drive
> the
> > price down and ruin the worth of the item. Half the fun in the game is
> > going and getting something for yourself. Buying items is definitely a
> part
>
> SBH spawns about every 2 or 2 and a half hours on the Shralok there, and
> as long as you have a high level wizard or two in your group, you can
> outgun the people. Is that worth 125pp or whatever it's going for? I'm
> sorry, but i can't make 125pp in 2 and a half hours. Nor can i make 125pp
> in a week. I've never made that much money, so i don't know how long it
> would take.
>
> > tried to get a BBC for about a month before I gave up because of campers
> and
> > kill stealers. Hard to express the anger you feel when you sit killing
> and
> > waiting for 3 plus hours only to have another group move in and steal
> the
> > kill to gain what you have been patiently waiting for.
>
> The Shadowknight that spawns with the BBC spawns every 30 minutes and
> everyone has to be in the main room to avoid the anticamp. If there is a
> group there doing it wrong, explain it to them, and if you do it right,
> they will be gone in half an hour with a BBC in their possesion and you
> can wait your half an hour to get one too.
>
> > Im off the track here. The point is, why drive the cost of something
> down?
> > You should want to keep the items worth something until the majority of
> > people in the game can get them for themselves. Otherwise you will see
> lvl
> > 3 and 4 characters running around with weapons that are level 15 or 20.
> And
> > they only paid 4plat for it.
>
> And this is exactly my point. I, at level 19, can get a majority of the
> good weapons in the game with a good party if given the chance. Everyone
> would get a chance if we figured out the system for these items. The price
> should not be for the people who spend 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
> playing. It should be something that the people who only have a couple
> hours a day to play can attain too.
>
> My opinion.
>
> Nick
>
>
